page.title: 08INDUSTRY IN DEEPCAR
page.content: The largest works in the area is {G.R.Stein Refractories,} Station Rd. 27 employees, mainly local. Most raw materials originate from abroad esp. Africa. Stein's add the water, mould it for furnace linings, distributing internationally. Transport by lorry.{ {Deepcar Road Transport}Manchester Rd. (Est.1920) 20 employees, mainly local. 15 motor units and 40 trailers. Operate nationwide but particularly for{British Steel}and Bass North Breweries. Formally Revill,Sons and Broadbent. Broadbent family still involved. {Elliotts Crane Repairs,}Carr Rd. (Est.1983). Original firm were Civil Engineers at Wortley Forge; they built the sewage works.7 employees. National and international customers. Machinery refurbished/stripped for spares. See {TOURISM}for old industries.
